results.title: Passage west. Program 2: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Bill Brind, ONF | NFB, British Broadcasting Corporation and Philip Donnellan
results.brief_description: Program 2 looks at the fortunes and misfortunes of British immigrants to Prince Edward Island, through a re-enactment of their history, letters, diaries, and interviews with their children and grandchildren.

results.title: Passage west. Program 1: A dream of freedom
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind and Philip Donnellan
results.brief_description: An examination of the great wave of British emigration to North America in the 19th century, based on historical documents, correspondence of the immigrants, and firsthand interviews with their descendents. A comparison is made with the plight of the modern immigrant.

results.title: Passage through The Wall
results.brief_description: A report on the short period when West Berliners were allowed to visit their relatives in East Berlin, Christmas 1963. It was the first time after more than two years that they were able to do so. East Berliners are sill not allowed to visit East Berlin.

results.title: Passage Out of Paradise
results.brief_description: A thousand miles in an open outrigger canoe, voyaging through some of the most beautiful islands and most treacherous waters on earth! This is the challenge accepted by nine crews from all over the world who gather in Bali to sail through the Indonesian archipelago, across the Timor Sea to Darwin. For crews of young men and women from Australia, U.K., Holland, Germany, France, Japan, U.S.A., New Zealand and Indonesia, it was an adventure that they will never forget.

results.title: Passage home
results.creator_credit: Julian Wintle, Group Film Productions and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: The steamer, “Bulinga” is the setting of this tense journey which takes the viewer on a passage from South America to England. The steamer is laden with pedigree bulls and Captain Lucky Ryland (Peter Finch) is pushing his crew to complete the trip in record breaking time. Adding to Lucky’s lack of cohesion with his crew members is the presence of Ruth (Diane Cilento), a passenger they have received orders to carry. Lucky raises the wrath of the first mate when he saves Ruth from being attacked by Lucky during one of his drunken binges. Lucky becomes isolated from the rest of the crew and shirks away from his responsibilities, until a violent storm hits the boat and they must put aside their differences to work as a team and survive. Cast also includes Anthony Steel, Cyril Cusack, Geoffrey Keen and Hugh Griffith. Based on a novel by Richard Armstrong.

results.title: Passage
results.creator_credit: Rene Jodoin, ONF | NFB and Normand Gregoire
results.brief_description: This film shows the capacity of the camera to suspend or speed up the viewer’s perception of motion. It is a film without words or people, where the screen is alive with light, movement and sound. Fleeting impressions are greatly accelerated as from the windows of a speeding train. The sun rockets through a vortex of clouds, light flickers — all to the shythm of chattering wheels.

results.title: Pass the word
results.creator_credit: Epilepsy Foundation of America and Dave Gilbert
results.brief_description: Epileptics face discrimination in the area of employment. Employees are reluctant to take on an epileptic, usually for reasons of job safety and insurance, this occurs especially in the manufacturing areas of employment. This film aims to improve the image of the epileptic, and to show that he is a valuable and productive member of the workforce.

results.title: Pass it on
results.brief_description: Points out the importance of understanding good communication and the propoer functioning of organizations, using the child’s game wherein one person passes information on the the next person and continues down the line. The theme is mis-communication in the workplace.

results.title: Pascali's island
results.creator_credit: Eric Fellner, Avenue Pictures, Initial Productions (US) and James Dearden
results.brief_description: For more than twenty years Basil Pascali (Ben Kingsley) has been a government spy on a Greek island in the Aegean reporting back to Constantinople. By 1908 he is accustomed to the lack of response on his reports and the monthly payment which has remained the same. Upon the arrival of an Englishman, Anthony Bowles (Charles Dance), who claims to be an archaeologist, he is quick to offer his services as an interpreter and negotiates a temporary lease on an area of land on the island. Pascali’s second mistake is to introduce the Englishman to Lydia (Helen Mirren), a Viennese painter for whom he nurses an unrequited passion and watches helplessly as they begin a passionate affair. When, by chance Bowles discovers a priceless statue, he invites Pascali to share in his joy, but the offer of genuine friendship goes unnoticed by the ever suspicious Pascali. This event leads to a betrayal that destroys his only chance of escaping the island. Based on the novel by Barry Unsworth.

results.title: Pas de deux
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren takes a look at the choreography of ballet, with cinema effects that are all you would expect from this master of improvisation in music and illustration. By exposing the same frames as many as ten times, the artist creates a multiple image of the ballerina and her partner (Margaret Mercier and Vincent Warren). A bare, black stage and back-lit figures, plus the remote, airy music of panpipes, produce a quiet and detachment similar to that of another McLaren film, “Lines”. Music by The United Folk Orchestra of Romania. (Seventeen awards, including Toronto; London; New York; Melbourne; Oscar nomination, Hollywood).
